programmes.show_description: (Some of) the best tracks to have soundtracked dance floors over the last 25 years!
6 Music takes you to the dark side with a playlist of the finest goth, electronic and dark pop music, with tracks from New Model Army, Childish Gambino, Brdmm and DJ Python.

programmes.show_name: Indie Forever Disco with Beth Ditto
programmes.show_description: Bringing the club vibes to you - wherever you are, whenever you want. Upbeat music to transport you to the dance floor from Fischerspooner, Gorillaz and CSS.
New age and ambient music pioneer Laraaji handpicks a two hour mix of beautiful calming tracks to boost your mindfulness.
Ease into Saturday with Afrodeutsche. The ultimate soft-launch for your weekend, two hours of fluid, deep-listening tracks designed to ground you before the day truly begins.
Mark and Stuart present a feast of great music and Faris Badwan of The Horrors shares his 'First, Last and Everything'.
Deb Grant serves a heady selection of audio sunshine from hip hop to soul to funk to rock to dub and more, including music from Jill Scott, Sylvester, Black Sabbath, Pete Rodriguez.
Jamz gets your weekend party started with an uplifting array of alternative RnB, broken beat, global club sounds and leftfield electronica.
Joining the musical dots, soul, hip-hop, house, Afro, Latin, electronica, jazz and beyond.

programmes.show_name: The Craig Charles Funk and Soul Show
programmes.show_description: BBE Music founder Peter Adarkwah digs into the crates with classics from the BBE catalogue, new label releases, and a selection of personal favourites past and present.
Don's Saturday night selections cross time, space and genre. Expect culture clash curve-balls from Tenor Saw, Warmduscher, Mungo's Hi-Fi, Wet Leg and Elijah Minnelli.
SHERELLE delves into drum and bass deep-cuts for your Saturday night.
30 minutes of ruff'n'ready drum and bass from the Bristolian producer, as he accepts the keys to the Sweatbox.
Exploring a genre truly borne out of the 2010s, in all of its kitsch glory: hyperpop.
Take a breath with this two-hour curated mix featuring Bob Marley, Lucy Dacus and Jim Croce.
A hand-picked mix of mellow music old and new.  With tracks from James Blake, Brian Eno, Derya Y ld r m & Grup Simsek, Perfume Genius, Jalen Ngonda, Can, HAIM, Royel Otis and more.
Reclaim your Sunday morning with Afrodeutsche. From ambient textures to soulful grooves, it's the restorative musical flow you need to reset your mind and find your center.
Ahead of World Book Day, Mark and Stuart present a feast of book-themed music and chat including tracks from Broadcast, Bo Diddley and Kate Bush.
St David's Day poetry and Welsh inspiration with Matthew Francis, plus fresh jazz perspectives and creative insights from Southbank Centre producer Deborah Bankole.
Guy chats to Thomas White of White Magic for Lovers and the Electric Soft Parade.
Iggy serves up a sonic cocktail to soundtrack your Sunday afternoon. This week, he's got Tyler, The Creator, Jenny Hval, Joe Tex, Fiona Apple and Brian Eno in his record bag.
With a borderless spectrum of music, new experiments in Storytelling and sound.
Stuart celebrates St David's Day with a Freak Zone Welsh special. Expect appearances from everyone from Richard Burton to Young Marble Giants.
Zakia guides us through two hours of swirling dreamy selections with a few Welsh picks as a nod to St David's Day, plus a Dreambience mix from French composer Colleen.
